intro: Pentalinon suberectum, commonly known as the erect pentalinon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. Its botanical features include hairy stems and stipules, which are common in many leguminous species. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
